page.title: 15Williton Station
page.content: For the last eight years the{West {Somerset Railway Company}has been running the longest privately owned railway in Great Britain. This Railway line runs the three kilometre squares in the West of this block. At{Williton Station}there is a signal box, goods shed and siding and a shop in the Station that is open during peak holiday times. The most interesting of these items is probably the{Signal Box.}This is a good example of the type known as the{Bristol and Exeter Railway box. It has 25 levers but no gate wheel so the gates over the litle used lane at the side have to be opened by hand. The Railway Company use this Station as one of thier Principal depots for the maintenance of the Permanent way and for the signals departments.
